subject: Public Speaking
title: Why Your Hands Shake
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Why Your Hands Shake.

hook.text: You step to the podium and your hands start trembling. You're not cold. Your body is dumping adrenaline.

buildup.text: Adrenaline redirects blood to large muscles for fighting or fleeing. Fine motor control in your hands suffers.

discovery.text: The tremor is your body preparing for physical action that won't come. A mismatch between signal and situation.

twist.text: Holding something heavy â€” a book, a glass of water â€” can actually dampen the shaking through muscle engagement.

climax.text: The shaking feels enormous to you. Audiences rarely notice it unless you draw attention to it yourself.

punchline.text: Your hands shake because your body thinks you're in a fight.

quiz.question: Why do hands shake during public speaking?
options: Adrenaline redirects blood to large muscles, reducing fine motor control
